CatDescriptText: Henry Gerard, 3408 Iowa Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 24, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you approve of women bartenders?" answer reads: "I approve because it creates an atmosphere as well as a job for the young ladies. Naturally, a male like to talk to a female.  With a woman bartender, you have a conversation as well as service.  This is a natural reaction."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Henry Gerard wearing hat, eyeglasses, and dark v-neck sweater, holding paper bag in left hand, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
